tags.description: Use helper calls to get information necessary to create an API client.
tags.name: Helper

tags.description: Manage API clients for the account.
tags.name: API clients

post.description: This operation creates a new API client. Optionally, you can automatically assign a credential for the client when you create it. If you choose not to assign the credential automatically, see [Create authentication credentials](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/set-up-authentication-credentials) for details.

example.clientDescription: Provides access to the reporting data.

clientType.description: Specifies the API client's ownership and credential management. `CLIENT` indicates the creator owns and manages the credentials. `USER_CLIENT` indicates another user owns the client and manages the credentials.

clientName.description: Descriptive label for the API client.

authorizedUsers.description: The API client's valid users. When the `clientType` is either `CLIENT` or `USER_CLIENT`, you need to specify a single `username` in the array. To get this data, run the [List authorized users](ref:get-api-clients-users) operation.

apiAccess.description: The APIs the API client can access.

allAccessibleApis.description: Enables the API client to access a full set of available APIs. Note there's a limit of 99 API services for each client. Clients that make calls to URLs from the 100th service get a 403 error.
Enables the API client to access a full set of available APIs. Note there's a limit of 99 API services for each client. Clients that make calls to URLs from the 100th service get a 403 error.
Enables the API client to access a full set of available APIs. Note there's a limit of 99 API services for each client. Clients that make calls to URLs from the 100th service get a 403 error.

apis.description: Set of APIs the API client can access when `allAccessibleApis` is disabled. To get this data, run the [List allowed APIs](ref:get-api-clients-users-allowed-apis) operation.

apiId.description: Unique identifier for each API. To get this value, run the [List allowed APIs](ref:get-api-clients-users-allowed-apis) operation.

documentationUrl.description: Link to more information about the API.

endPoint.description: Specifies where the API can access resources.

accessLevel.description: The API client's access level on a per API basis, either `READ-ONLY` or `READ-WRITE`.

groupAccess.description: Specifies the API client's group access.

cloneAuthorizedUserGroups.description: Sets the API client's group access the same as the authorized user. Set it to `false` and specify the access in the `groups` array.

groups.description: Groups the API client can access. To get this data, run the [List accessible groups](ref:get-api-clients-users-group-access) operation.

items.description: The groups an API client can access.

groupId.description: A unique identifier for each group.

roleId.description: A unique identifier for each role.

roleDescription.description: The human-readable description for a role.

parentGroupId.description: The unique identifier for the parent group within the group tree. If you're viewing group info for a root-level group, you may not see this member.

isBlocked.description: If `true`, the API client has access to the group's parent, but can't access the child group.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group, represented as an array of groups. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

cloneAuthorizedUserGroups.description: Set it to `true` to clone the API client's group access from the authorized user.

groups.description: Groups the API client can access. To get this data, run the [List accessible groups](ref:get-api-clients-users-group-access) operation.

items.description: The groups an API client can access.

groupId.description: A unique identifier for each group.

roleId.description: A unique identifier for each role.

roleDescription.description: The human-readable description for a role.

parentGroupId.description: The unique identifier for the parent group within the group tree. If you're viewing group info for a root-level group, you may not see this member.

isBlocked.description: If `true`, the API client has access to the group's parent, but can't access the child group.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group, represented as an array of groups. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

allowAccountSwitch.description: Enables the API client to manage more than one account. For details, see [Manage many accounts with one API client](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client).

canAutoCreateCredential.description: Whether the API client can create a credential for a new API client. The default is `false`.

createCredential.description: With `canAutoCreateCredential` enabled, setting this to `true` creates new credentials along with a new API client. The default is `false`.

clientDescription.description: Descriptive label about the API client.

notificationEmails.description: Email addresses to notify users of expiring credentials.

purgeOptions.description: Configures the API client for access to the [Fast Purge API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/purge-cache/reference/api). Provide it only if the `apis` object includes an `apiName` of `CCU APIs`.

canPurgeByCacheTag.description: Whether the API client can purge content by cache tag.

canPurgeByCpcode.description: Whether the API client can purge content by CP code.

cpcodeAccess.description: CP codes the API client can purge.

allCurrentAndNewCpcodes.description: Whether the API client can purge content by cache tag.

cpcodes.description: CP codes the API client can purge. To get these values, run the [List allowed CP codes](ref:post-api-clients-users-allowed-cpcodes) operation.

ipAcl.description: Specifies the API client's IP list restriction.

enable.description: Enables API client's access to the IP ACL.

cidr.description: IP addresses or CIDR blocks the API client can access.

201.description: The response provides the newly created API client.

Location.description: A URL path to the newly created object.

example.clientDescription: Used to create users across partner accounts.

accessToken.description: Part of the client secret that identifies your API client and lets you access applications and resources. It helps form the unique hostname the client uses to call the API. Tokens are unique per client.

actions.description: Specifies activities available for the API client.

delete.description: Whether you can remove the API client.

deactivateAll.description: Whether you can deactivate the API client's credentials.

edit.description: Whether you can update the API client.

editApis.description: Whether you can update the `apis` the API client can access.

editAuth.description: Whether you can update the `groups` or `apis` the API client can access.

editGroups.description: Whether you can update the `groups` the API client can access.

editIpAcl.description: Whether you can update the `ipAcl` the API client can access.

editSwitchAccount.description: Whether you can update the API client's option to manage many accounts.

lock.description: Whether you can lock the API client.

transfer.description: Whether you can transfer the API client to a new owner.

unlock.description: Whether you can unlock the API client.

activeCredentialCount.description: Number of credentials active for the API client. When the count is zero, you can delete the API client without interruption.

allowAccountSwitch.description: Whether the API client can manage more than one account. For details, see [Manage many accounts with one API client](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client).

canAutoCreateCredential.description: Whether the API client can create a credential for a new API client.

apiAccess.description: The APIs the API client can access.

allAccessibleApis.description: Whether the API client has access to a full set of available APIs. Note there's a limit of 99 API services for each client. Clients that make calls to URLs from the 100th service get a 403 error.

apis.description: Set of APIs the API client can access when `allAccessibleApis` is disabled.

documentationUrl.description: Link to more information about the API.

endPoint.description: Specifies where the API can access resources.

accessLevel.description: The API client's access level on a per API basis, either `READ-ONLY` or `READ-WRITE`.

baseURL.description: The base URL for the service.

purgeOptions.description: Configures the API client for access to the [Fast Purge API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/purge-cache/reference/api). It's returned only if the `apis` object includes an `apiName` of `CCU APIs`.

canPurgeByCacheTag.description: Whether the API client can purge content by cache tag.

canPurgeByCpcode.description: Whether the API client can purge content by CP code.

cpcodeAccess.description: CP codes the API client can purge.

allCurrentAndNewCpcodes.description: Whether the API client can purge content by cache tag.

cpcodes.description: CP codes the API client can purge.

clientDescription.description: Descriptive label about the API client.

clientId.description: Unique identifier for each API client.

clientType.description: Specifies the API client's ownership and credential management. `CLIENT` indicates the creator owns and manages the credentials. `USER_CLIENT` indicates another user owns the client and manages the credentials.

clientName.description: Descriptive label for the API client.

createdBy.description: The user who created the API client.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the API client was created.

description.description: Descriptive label for the API client.

actions.description: Specifies activities available for the credential.

delete.description: Whether you can remove the credential.

activate.description: Whether you can activate the credential.

deactivate.description: Whether you can deactivate the credential.

editDescription.description: Whether you can modify the credential's description.

editExpiration.description: Whether you can modify the credential's expiration date.

clientToken.description: Part of the credential that identifies the API client.

createdOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the credential was created.

expiresOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp for when the credential expires. The default expiration date is two years from the creation date.

status.description: Whether a credential is `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, or `DELETED`. Activating or deactivating the credential changes the value between `ACTIVE` and `INACTIVE`, but you can't reactivate any `DELETED` credentials.

groupAccess.description: Specifies the API client's group access.

cloneAuthorizedUserGroups.description: Sets the API client's group access the same as the authorized user.

groups.description: Groups the API client can access.

items.description: The groups an API client can access.

groupId.description: A unique identifier for each group.

roleId.description: A unique identifier for each role.

roleDescription.description: The human-readable description for a role.

parentGroupId.description: The unique identifier for the parent group within the group tree. If you're viewing group info for a root-level group, you may not see this member.

isBlocked.description: If `true`, the API client has access to the group's parent, but can't access the child group.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group, represented as an array of groups. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

ipAcl.description: Specifies the API client's IP list restriction.

enable.description: Enables API client's access to the IP ACL.

cidr.description: IP addresses or CIDR blocks the API client can access.

isLocked.description: Whether the user's account is locked. To learn more, see [Temporary account lockout](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/tmp-account-lockout).

notificationEmails.description: Email addresses to notify users of expiring credentials.

serviceProviderId.description: Unique identifier for the API's service provider.

get.description: This operation lists API clients an administrator can manage on the current account or other managed accounts using the `accountSwitchKey` parameter.

parameters.description: Includes actions you can perform on the object, `false` by default.
parameters.name: actions

200.description: The response provides a list of API clients an administrator can manage.

example.clientDescription: Provides access to the reporting data.

accessToken.description: Part of the client secret that identifies your API client and lets you access applications and resources. It helps form the unique hostname the client uses to call the API. Tokens are unique per client.

actions.description: Specifies activities available for the API client.

delete.description: Whether you can remove the API client.

deactivateAll.description: Whether you can deactivate the API client's credentials.

edit.description: Whether you can update the API client.

lock.description: Whether you can lock the API client.

transfer.description: Whether you can transfer the API client to a new owner.

unlock.description: Whether you can unlock the API client.

activeCredentialCount.description: Number of credentials active for the API client. When the count is zero, you can delete the API client without interruption.

allowAccountSwitch.description: Whether the API client can manage more than one account. For details, see [Manage many accounts with one API client](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client).

canAutoCreateCredential.description: Whether the API client can create a credential for a new API client.

clientDescription.description: Descriptive label about the API client.

clientId.description: Unique identifier for each API client.

clientName.description: Descriptive label for the API client.

clientType.description: Specifies the API client's ownership and credential management. `CLIENT` indicates the creator owns and manages the credentials. `USER_CLIENT` indicates another user owns the client and manages the credentials. `SERVICE_ACCOUNT` indicates only `authorizedUsers` can manage the client's credentials. The default is `CLIENT`.

createdBy.description: The user who created the API client.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the API client was created.

isLocked.description: Whether the user's account is locked. To learn more, see [Temporary account lockout](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/tmp-account-lockout).

notificationEmails.description: Email addresses to notify users of expiring credentials.

serviceConsumerToken.description: Unique identifier for the service hostname.

get.description: Returns details about your API client.

200.description: The response returns the API client.

schema.description: This object encapsulates the response schema for creating API client.

accessToken.description: Part of the client secret that identifies your API client and lets you access applications and resources. Tokens are unique per client.

actions.description: Encapsulates actions the API client may perform.

delete.description: When enabled, the API client can be deleted.

deactivateAll.description: When enabled, all credentials of the API client can be deactivated.

edit.description: When enabled, the API client can be updated.

editApis.description: When enabled, the `apis` of the API client can be updated.

editAuth.description: When enabled, the `groups` or `apis` of the API client can be updated.

editGroups.description: When enabled, the `groups` of the API client can be updated.

editSwitchAccount.description: When enabled, the API client option to manage many accounts can be updated.

lock.description: When enabled, the API client can be locked if it's currently unlocked.

transfer.description: When enabled, the API client can be transferred to a new owner.

unlock.description: When enabled, the API client can be unlocked if it's currently locked.

activeCredentialCount.description: Number of credentials active for the API client.

allAccessibleApis.description: Indicates if the API client has access to a full set of available APIs. Note there's a limit of 99 API services for each client. Clients that make calls to URLs from the 100th service get a 403 error.

allowAccountSwitch.description: If you can use the API client to manage more than one account.

apis.description: Lists APIs you'd like to use. It's a specific set of accessible APIs only when `allAccessibleApis` is disabled.

apiId.description: A unique identifier for each API.

apiName.description: The name of an API, like Diagnostic Tools, or Identity Management: API.

documentationUrl.description: Link to more information about the API.

endPoint.description: The endpoint to access a API.

grantScope.description: The level of access you give to an API client on a per API basis.

baseURL.description: The base URL for the service.

ccuParams.description: Additional data needed to configure the client for access to CCU API in `apis`.

purgeByCacheTag.description: When enabled, the API client can purge content by cache tag.

purgeByCpcode.description: When enabled, the API client can purge content by CP code.

purgeCpcodes.description: Lists all CP codes that your API client is allowed to purge.

clientId.description: Unique identifier for an API client.

createdBy.description: The user who created the API client.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the API client was created.

description.description: A descriptive label for the client.

actions.description: Encapsulates the different ways you can edit an API client, including changing its owner, accessing rights to Control Center, or deleting it.

delete.description: When enabled, the credential can be deleted.

activate.description: When enabled, the credential can be activated.

deactivate.description: When enabled, the credential can be deactivated.

editDescription.description: When enabled, credential's description can be edited.

editExpiration.description: When enabled, credential's expiration date can be updated.

createdOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when credentials were created.

credentialId.description: A unique identifier for each credential.

expiresOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the credential expire. By default, two years from the creation date.

status.description: Indicates whether the credential can be used. `ACTIVE` means the credential can be used. `INACTIVE` means the credential isn't active and can't be used, and `DELETED` means the credential no longer exists.

groups.description: The groups an API client can access.

items.description: The groups an API client can access.

groupId.description: A unique identifier for each group.

roleId.description: A unique identifier for each role.

roleDescription.description: The human-readable description for a role.

parentGroupId.description: The unique identifier for the parent group within the group tree. If you're viewing group info for a root-level group, you may not see this member.

isBlocked.description: If `true`, the API client has access to the group's parent, but can't access the child group.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group, represented as an array of groups. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

locked.description: When enabled, you can lock the client to prevent anyone from using it to access services on Control Center.

notificationList.description: List of email addresses to notify of any expiring credentials.

serviceProviderId.description: A unique identifier for a service provider.

uiIdentityId.description: The unique identifier of the user the API client is being created for.

uiUserName.description: The human-readable username of the person who owns the API client.

useOwnerGroups.description: When enabled, grants the client the same group access as the owner. Otherwise access is limited to the groups specified in `groups`.

get.description: The response object contains the `accountSwitchKeys` and account names you can access based on the permissions of your API client. Once you have the `accountSwitchKeys`, you can make an API call to another account. To learn more, see [Manage many accounts with one API client](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filters results by `accountId` or `accountName`. Enter at least three characters in the string to filter the results.

200.description: The response lists account switch keys.

schema.description: This object encapsulates a collection of contexts the client can manage.

accountName.description: The name you supply for an account.

accountSwitchKey.description: The identifier for an account other than your API client's default.

put.description: This operation locks your API client. You can't use the API client while it's locked. To unlock your client, run the [Unlock an API client](ref:put-unlock-api-client) operation.

200.description: The response provides the locked API client.

example.clientDescription: Provides access to the reporting data.

accessToken.description: Part of the client secret that identifies your API client and lets you access applications and resources. It helps form the unique hostname the client uses to call the API. Tokens are unique per client.

activeCredentialCount.description: Number of credentials active for the API client. When the count is zero, you can delete the API client without interruption.

allowAccountSwitch.description: Whether the API client can manage more than one account. For details, see [Manage many accounts with one API client](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client).

canAutoCreateCredential.description: Whether the API client can create a credential for a new API client.

clientId.description: Unique identifier for each API client.

clientName.description: Descriptive label for the API client.

clientType.description: Specifies the API client's ownership and credential management. `CLIENT` indicates the creator owns and manages the credentials. `USER_CLIENT` indicates another user owns the client and manages the credentials. `SERVICE_ACCOUNT` indicates only `authorizedUsers` can manage the client's credentials. The default is `CLIENT`.

createdBy.description: The user who created the API client.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the API client was created.

isLocked.description: Whether the user's account is locked. To learn more, see [Temporary account lockout](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/tmp-account-lockout).

notificationEmails.description: Email addresses to notify users of expiring credentials.

serviceConsumerToken.description: Unique identifier for the service hostname.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for each API client.

parameters.name: propertyId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for each property.

get.description: List users who can access this property.

parameters.name: userType
parameters.description: Indicates the type of users to get, either those who have `lostAccess` or the reverse `gainAccess`.

schema.description: All the users of a property, by property ID.

authorizedUsers.description: The API client's valid users. When the `clientType` is either `CLIENT` or `USER_CLIENT`, you need to specify a single `username` in the array. To get this data, run the [List authorized users](ref:get-api-clients-users) operation.

api-client.description: This object encapsulates the response schema for creating API client.

accessToken.description: Part of the client secret that identifies your API client and lets you access applications and resources. Tokens are unique per client.

actions.description: Encapsulates actions the API client may perform.

delete.description: When enabled, the API client can be deleted.

deactivateAll.description: When enabled, all credentials of the API client can be deactivated.

edit.description: When enabled, the API client can be updated.

editApis.description: When enabled, the `apis` of the API client can be updated.

editAuth.description: When enabled, the `groups` or `apis` of the API client can be updated.

editGroups.description: When enabled, the `groups` of the API client can be updated.

editSwitchAccount.description: When enabled, the API client option to manage many accounts can be updated.

lock.description: When enabled, the API client can be locked if it's currently unlocked.

transfer.description: When enabled, the API client can be transferred to a new owner.

unlock.description: When enabled, the API client can be unlocked if it's currently locked.

activeCredentialCount.description: Number of credentials active for the API client.

allAccessibleApis.description: Indicates if the API client has access to a full set of available APIs. Note there's a limit of 99 API services for each client. Clients that make calls to URLs from the 100th service get a 403 error.

allowAccountSwitch.description: If you can use the API client to manage more than one account.

apis.description: Lists APIs you'd like to use. It's a specific set of accessible APIs only when `allAccessibleApis` is disabled.

apiId.description: A unique identifier for each API.

apiName.description: The name of an API, like Diagnostic Tools, or Identity Management: API.

documentationUrl.description: Link to more information about the API.

endPoint.description: The endpoint to access a API.

grantScope.description: The level of access you give to an API client on a per API basis.

baseURL.description: The base URL for the service.

purgeByCpcode.description: When enabled, the API client can purge content by CP code.

purgeCpcodes.description: Lists all CP codes that your API client is allowed to purge.
